node.title: One Small Step For Man, One Giant Leap for Snoopy: Plush Version Scheduled for Rocket Ride
node.description: On the Artemis I unmanned mission, a plush version of Snoopy will board a new rocket to circle the moon and return to Earth in a test launch.

node.title: Chicago Approaching 700 Homicides for 2021, Chinese College Student Latest Victim
node.description: A friend at a vigil for Shaoxiong "Dennis" Zheng vigil describe him as being a "really positive, nice person" who loved Chicago and enjoyed being there.

node.title: In Paris, VP Harris seeks to strengthen ties, stay out of headlines
node.description: If you were in Paris this week, you could be forgiven for not knowing that Vice President Kamala Harris was here too.

node.title: On Podcasts and Radio, Misleading Covid-19 Talk Goes Unchecked
node.description: False statements about vaccines have spread on the “Wild West” of media, even as some hosts die of virus complications.

node.title: ‘We can push the dialogue along’: This art festival is changing institutions from the inside
node.description: In its sixth year, Tarnanthi, the Art Gallery of South Australia’s festival of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art, remains committed to supporting First Nations artists and elevating their voices.

node.title: England coach Eddie Jones shines in a week of Master Coach trickery, but the Wallabies have too many issues to take note
node.description: Injuries force Wallabies into a selection reshuffle, with a shock Test debutant named in the side to take on England this Sunday. But all the English focus has been on master coach Eddie Jones, who did what he always does when his team faces scrutiny: distraction.

node.title: The 'soul destroying' crime against children so unspeakable it goes undetected
node.description: Of the 1.4 million adults sexually abused as children, only a fraction were first abused by a stranger.

node.title: 'Relax on demand': What a freediver and a yoga teacher know about breathing
node.description: Breathing is instinctual but that doesn't mean it can't be improved. Using different techniques for different types of exercise can impact your performance and daily life.

node.title: Jeongyeong's baby girl is the 'most beautiful decision' he's made. But he still hasn't met her
node.description: Jeongyeong's first child, a baby girl, was born in August last year. But he's never been able to hold her, and temporary residents like his wife are left in limbo as Australia's borders reopen.

node.title: Qatar to Represent U.S. Interests in Afghanistan, Blinken Says
node.description: The Gulf nation will also help process visas for thousands of people trying to flee the Taliban.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: Outbreak spreads to Taranaki and vaccine mandates for police
node.description: Outbreak spreads to Taranaki, Pfizer applies to Medsafe for paediatric vaccine approval and police given until mid-January to be fully vaccinated.

node.title: The IRS says it's boosting tax brackets due to inflation
node.description: The top tax rate remains 37%, but married taxpayers will need to earn almost $20,000 more to enter the bracket.

node.title: Man who traveled to space on Blue Origin flight dies in plane crash
node.description: Last month, de Vries launched to space with actor William Shatner and two other crewmates.

node.title: Behold, King Tut, in All His Majesty and Mystery
node.description: “The Curse of the Mummy” and “King Tutankhamun Tells All!” reintroduce the boy pharaoh to young readers.

node.title: Review: When Real Life Adds an Unexpected Round to the Fugue
node.description: Created during the pandemic, Zvi Gotheiner’s “The Art of Fugue,” performed by ZviDance at New York Live Arts, now registers as a work of recovery.

node.title: Review: Sensation and Skin, in a Theater Housed in Bodies
node.description: Luciana Achugar presents the premiere of “Puro Teatro: A Spell for Utopia” at the new, improved Chocolate Factory, but its pleasures feel one-sided.

node.title: The Challenges Faced by the Democrats
node.description: Readers discuss Maureen Dowd’s criticisms of President Biden and the Democrats. Also: A new university; investing in people; unvaccinated home aides.

node.title: Menace, as a Political Tool, Enters the Republican Mainstream
node.description: Threats of violence have become commonplace among a significant part of the party, as historians and those who study democracy warn of a dark shift in American politics.

node.title: NJ Democrat Concerned State Senate Leadership is Again All White Men, Plans Challenge
node.description: "When the doors close on those discussions, there will not be a voice of a woman. There will not be a voice of a minority there," state Senator Nia Gill said.

node.title: Sleep Disorders Could Lead to Worse COVID Outcomes, Study Finds
node.description: The study showed an connection between sleep disorders and the risk for "adverse" COVID-19 outcomes, according to Cleveland Clinic.

node.title: Rochester Dealing With 'Unprecedented' Gun Violence, Seeing an Almost 100 Percent Increase
node.description: On Friday, Mayor Lovely Warren declared a state of emergency due to the rise in gun violence. The city has already seen 71 homicides this year.

node.title: 'If You Have a Dream, Follow It': Man Earns Ph.D. in Physics at 89
node.description: After spending most of his career in medicine, Manfred Steiner decided to pursue his dream of becoming a physicist.

node.title: As food prices rise, Auckland City Mission sees higher demand for services
node.description: Over the past three months, the demand for Te Tāpui Atawhai Auckland City Mission's services has been the highest in the organisation's 100-year history.

node.title: Cop Searched For Ahmaud Arbery Days Before Death to Tell Him Not to Enter Unfinished Home
node.description: Owners of the home where Ahmaud Arbery was trespassing went to police after seeing the same person enter after dark but didn't think anything was stolen.

node.title: Doctor Accused of Lying About Needing Rescue Chopper After Troubled Denali Climb
node.description: Jason Lance, a Utah doctor, is facing three misdemeanor charges after allegedly lying about fellow climbers being in the early stages of hypothermia.

node.title: Madison Cawthorn Seeking Second Term in New District to Keep 'Go-Along' Republican Out

node.title: Jailed Capitol Rioter Admits to Bringing Firearm, Molotov Cocktails to D.C.

node.title: Portugal's Catholic bishops announce independent child sexual abuse commission
node.description: The time span to be covered by the commission's investigations is not yet clear but the letter's signatories suggested it should cover five decades.

node.title: The Celtics Are Starting to Get Their Act Together
node.description: After spiraling toward dysfunction, Boston has righted the ship for its new coach, Ime Udoka.

node.title: Amid Tensions With China, Biden to Discuss Competition During Virtual Summit With Xi
node.description: White House officials hold low expectations for the meeting between the two leaders on Monday evening, and expect no major announcements to come from it.

node.title: Auckland misses out on international summer of cricket
node.description: Auckland will miss out on hosting the Black Caps and White Ferns this summer, following New Zealand Cricket's release of the domestic international schedule for the two sides.

node.title: New Orleans to pay teens $350 a month in financial literacy push
node.description: City officials believe a $3,500 annual payout to young people could help solve the "unbanked" problem plaguing the Big Easy.

node.title: Obama, Bush, Clinton ask for support to build Medal of Honor museum
node.description: The presidents recorded a video urging Americans to support a museum to honor America's heroes.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check

node.title: Five-Star, Honey-Glazed Chicken
node.description: Yewande Komolafe graced us with this one-pan recipe. Don’t miss it.

node.title: The Absolute Best Pumpkin, Apple and Pecan Pies for Thanksgiving
node.description: Melissa Clark has spent months perfecting techniques, so you don’t have to.

node.title: Astroworld Disaster Rekindles Fears About Music Festival Safety
node.description: The concert industry notes that serious problems are still rare, but over the years a number of deadly stampedes have shown the inherent dangers of big, excited crowds.

node.title: Sonic Sensations: Picture Books About Nina Simone and Jimi Hendrix
node.description: “Nina,” by Traci N. Todd, and “Song for Jimi,” by Charles R. Smith Jr., spotlight Black musicians who broke sound and color barriers.

node.title: Wonking Out: How Global Is Inflation?
node.description: And Queen Victoria as a differential equation.

node.title: Inflation is driving a sharp downturn in U.S. consumer views about the economy.

node.title: Elon Musk Has Sold $5.69B in Tesla Shares This Week, Still Owns 17 Percent of Company
node.description: Musk is the wealthiest person in the world with a net worth of around $278.7 billion, according to Forbes.

node.title: Man Allegedly Issues Death Threat to GOP Lawmaker Over Vote for Infrastructure Package
node.description: Long Island resident Kenneth Gasper has been charged with aggravated second-degree harassment against Republican Rep. Andrew Garbarino of New York.

node.title: Utah Man Allegedly Paid Hitmen Bitcoin to Kill Two People Amid Custody Battle
node.description: If convicted, Christopher Pence faces a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison, according to the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Northern District of New York.

node.title: Ben Crump Vows to Bring 100 Black Pastors to Pray with Arbery Family After Defense Comment
node.description: Crump's remarks come in response to the defense's controversial comment that "we don't want any more Black pastors coming in [to the court]."

node.title: Ex-High School Coach Under Investigation for Conducting Body Fat Tests on Nude Athletes
node.description: Aaron Thomas resigned from North Kingstown High School, where he coached and taught since the 1990s, in June after the accusations were made public.

node.title: Australian-first study paves way for mothers returning to elite sport
node.description: Some of Australia's top female sportswomen have criticised the lack of support for new mums, prompting the Australia Institution of Sport to investigate.

node.title: A princess and a rugby royal are working to counter vaccine misinformation in the Pacific
node.description: Influential figures from across the Pacific are working to ensure public health messages relating to COVID-19 reach communities at a time where misinformation and vaccine hesitancy are rife across the region.

node.title: Why a huge surge in US inflation could derail the Australian property market
node.description: The Australian property market has for many years defied the laws of gravity. But analysts are warning a huge surge in US inflation has the potential to derail the Australian property market, writes David Taylor.

node.title: Pacific leaders vow to halt increasing fossil fuel subsidies and share COVID-19 vaccine technology
node.description: Pacific leaders, hosted entirely online by New Zealand, agree to chart a road to post-pandemic recovery to ensure the Asia-Pacific region "remains the world’s most dynamic and interconnected regional economy".

node.title: This sleepy country town is a secretive centre for Big Pharma drug production
node.description: This is the strange story of how a small, unassuming country town and a native plant became the epicentre for a major pharmaceutical drug industry and an alleged criminal cartel.

node.title: The lasting scars of lockdown will shape the election, but the Prime Minister is looking elsewhere
node.description: Whether you take a benign view of China's intentions, or an alarmed one, Taiwan and China are now becoming a very, very complex problem for everyone — including Australia, writes Laura Tingle.

node.title: What happens when Australia's COVID-19 'honeymoon' ends? Singapore offers warning
node.description: Many Australians are rightly looking forward to a carefree summer. However, experts warn Singapore's current COVID-19 surge may be a prime example of how Australia could struggle to remain virus-free for very long.

node.title: Biden and Xi to meet virtually on Monday
node.description: The White House says the president will be "candid about our concerns" with China.

node.title: It’s Time to Get Honest About the Biden Doctrine
node.description: Twentieth-century frameworks, paradigms and doctrines, of any kind, are  insufficient to meet the challenges of the 21st century.

node.title: Kellogg's Sues Striking Workers, Says They're Intimidating Replacements, Blocking Entrances
node.description: The Kellogg Co. asked a judge to order striking workers to stop interfering with its business, stating they blocked entrances and threatened replacements.

node.title: Covid-19: Victoria records 1115 new cases and 9 deaths, NSW has 286 cases, 2 deaths
node.description: Victoria has recorded 1115 new local Covid-19 cases and nine deaths.

node.title: Accused Capitol rioter who fled to Russian ally rails against U.S.

node.title: McDonald's CEO faces backlash over gun victim texts

node.description: Zhu Wang played an unusually interesting and adventurous set of pieces at Zankel Hall.

node.description: Califf also served in this role during the Obama administration.

node.title: Review: The Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason Makes an Entrance
node.description: A young star made his New York Philharmonic debut in an evening of bold, charismatic musical storytelling.

node.title: Henry Ruggs Charged With Four Felonies After Fatal Car Crash
node.description: Prosecutors in Clark County, Nev., charged the former N.F.L. player with two felony counts of driving under the influence, two felony counts of reckless driving and a misdemeanor gun charge.

node.title: Fashionably Late to the Climate Crisis
node.description: How do you fix the fashion industry? This sustainability expert has a few ideas.

node.title: Will Real Estate Ever Be Normal Again?
node.description: In Austin and cities around the country, prices are skyrocketing, forcing regular people to act like speculators. When will it end?

node.title: Murkowski Announces Re-election Bid, Setting up Clash With Trump
node.description: Of the seven Republicans who found former President Donald J. Trump guilty in his second impeachment trial, the Alaska senator is the only one facing re-election this year.

node.title: California broadens access to Covid booster shots.
node.description: Officials are seeking to avert a winter surge; last year, so many Covid patients died that officials were forced to deploy mobile morgues.

node.title: Woman Filmed Giving Birth on Front Lawn by Doorbell Cam in California
node.description: "No one was expecting him to be born that day, definitely I wasn't," the mother, Emily Johnson, said.

node.title: Jury Suggests 28-Year Sentence for Joseph Elledge in Wife's Death, Made Decision in 7 Hours
node.description: Elledge admitted during the trial that he had buried his wife's body and misguided authorities for more than a year about her whereabouts.

node.title: Video of Joe Biden's 'Great Negro' Remarks About Satchel Paige Viewed Over 4.5M Times
node.description: The president during a Veterans Day speech at Arlington National Cemetery referred to Satchel Paige as "the great negro."

node.title: Why the Internet Is Feeling Sorry for a Robot: 'Screaming and Panic'
node.description: The robot installation has become the focus of online videos edited with sad music and filters, as people claim to feel sad for the machine.

node.title: 6-Year-Old's Lost Teddy Bear Becomes Park Ranger's 'Mascot' Before Going Back Home

node.title: Defense Attorney Apologizes for Black Pastors Comment During Racially Charged Arbery Case
node.description: Attorney Kevin Gough has received national blowback for asking the court to limit the number of Black pastors that were allowed to attend the case in Gerogia.

node.title: Woman Says Sister Is Trying to Steal Baby Name for Her Own 'Miracle' Baby in Viral Post
node.description: "I told her that she can name her baby whatever she wants, but that we're not changing our minds about our baby's name," the post explained.

node.title: USPS is delivering mail slower than promised ahead of holidays
node.description: The crucial holiday season poses a test for the postal service, which already has slowed mail delivery amid budget pressures.

node.title: Dazzling Accessories That Catch the Light
node.description: This season, stand out from the crowd with sparkly, crystal-encrusted bags and shoes.

node.title: The Ever-Evolving Art of Bonsai
node.description: The centuries-old craft is thriving as both a hobby and an art form, with contemporary practitioners around the world asking what lessons it can impart today.

node.title: Here’s the Secret to the Best Mashed Potatoes for Thanksgiving
node.description: You’ve tried boiling, but Genevieve Ko found a better way to make this side dish fluffier — and more flavorful.

node.title: Tales That Linger in Your Mind and Take up Residency in Your Soul
node.description: Our crime fiction columnist assesses three riveting new novels and an emotionally devastating short-story collection.

node.title: Picturing the Power of Community
node.description: Four invitations to reach across borders and affirm our shared humanity.

node.title: Like Riding a Bike: A Middle Grade Novel Asks, What if We Do Forget How?
node.description: In Alejandra Algorta’s “Neverforgotten,” illustrated by Iván Rickenmann, a baker’s son loses trust in himself, and has to gain it back.

node.description: Ricardo Pepi has played only four games for the U.S., but he provides the one thing his team needs most: goals.

node.title: Ethiopian Civil War Sparks Rancorous Debate over Immigration to Israel
node.description: Thousands of relatives of the remnants of Ethiopian Jewry are waiting to be airlifted to Israel. For now, the Israeli government sees no urgency.

node.title: In Border Crisis, Europe’s Unsavory Migration Deals Come Home
node.description: Europe has long paid other nations to keep refugees away from its borders. Now, Belarus wants something, too, and has brought migrants right to Europe’s door to get it.

node.title: ‘Be Nice to Tourists’: New York’s Arts Scene Needs International Visitors
node.description: The United States now allows vaccinated international travelers into the country. It’s welcome news for arts institutions that lost revenue and cut jobs during the pandemic.

node.title: Flights to Belarus Halted for Citizens in 3 Countries by Turkish Airlines Amid EU Pressure
node.description: The Turkish Civil Aviation Authority has stopped selling plane tickets for Iraqis, Syrians and Yemenis to Minsk, a popular illegal EU entry point.

node.title: China Lashes Out at Human Rights Watch for 'Fabricating Lies,' Politicizing 2022 Olympics
node.description: After the Human Rights Watch sent letters to the IOC's TOP sponsors asking them to be aware of human rights climate, China continued to deny violations.

node.title: Las Vegas Road Sign Saying 'Mash Potatoes Not Your Head' Branded 'Disturbing'
node.description: The sign appeared on the I-15 in Las Vegas, telling passengers to "buckle up."

node.title: Central Park's Touching Bench Plaques Pull at Heartstrings: 'Marry Me'
node.description: The heartwarming dedications have been viewed over one million times, and pay tribute to lost loved ones, or in some cases, propose marriages years early.

node.title: Trump Aide Mark Meadows Skips January 6 Testimony Despite Legal Threats
node.description: Trump's chief of staff when a mob of Trump supporters stormed the U.S. Capitol now faces potential criminal or civil action.

node.title: Black Officer Who Found 'KKK' Note on Raincoat From Ex-Police Chief Files Complaint
node.description: The former police chief made a "pointy KKK hat out of paper" and wore it in front of the officer and told him that he should wear that hat on his next call.
